grade_comment:
Grade: 90

Comment: The response provides a comprehensive and in-depth analysis of Jesus' self-identification as the "Son of Man" in the New Testament, connecting it to its Hebrew scripture roots, Jesus' humanity and divinity, messianic identity, divine authority, eschatological significance, and connection to God. It effectively explains the implications of this title for our faith, highlighting Jesus' unique role as the Messiah and His dual nature as fully human and fully divine. The response demonstrates a solid understanding of the Christian significance of Jesus' self-identification as the "Son of Man." Great job!
